intro: Oxythece pallida, commonly known as the pale oxythece, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish. Oxythece pallida is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators.
